intro: Horkelia grandis, commonly known as the large horkelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats such as grasslands and sagebrush steppe. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Horkelia grandis is often found in arid environments and is adapted to thrive in regions with limited water availability.
